questions: 1What is the main purpose of a simple machine?
answers: 1To make work easier by changing the force or direction of the effort.

questions: 2How does an inclined plane reduce the amount of force needed?
answers: 2It spreads the required force over a longer distance.

questions: 3What are the six types of simple machines?
answers: 3Inclined plane, wedge, screw, lever, pulley, and wheel and axle.

questions: 4How does a lever work to move a heavy object?
answers: 4It uses a rigid bar that pivots on a fulcrum to multiply force.

questions: 5What is a real-world example of a first-class lever?
answers: 5A seesaw, where the fulcrum is between the effort and the load.

questions: 6How does a wheel and axle help make work easier?
answers: 6It reduces friction and allows easier movement or lifting of loads.

questions: 7What type of simple machine is a knife and how does it work?
answers: 7A wedge; it splits objects apart by concentrating force to a narrow edge.

questions: 8How does a pulley system make lifting heavy objects easier?
answers: 8It changes the direction of force and can multiply the force with more pulleys.

questions: 9What is mechanical advantage in the context of simple machines?
answers: 9It is the ratio of output force to input force, showing how much a machine multiplies effort.

questions: 10How can a screw be considered a simple machine?
answers: 10It is an inclined plane wrapped around a cylinder, converting rotational force into linear motion.

questions: 11What is the relationship between effort distance and force in simple machines?
answers: 11The longer the effort distance, the less force is needed to do the same work.

questions: 12What is a real-world example of a wheel and axle?
answers: 12A doorknob, where turning the knob (wheel) turns the shaft (axle).

questions: 13What is the difference between a single fixed pulley and a movable pulley?
answers: 13A fixed pulley only changes direction, while a movable pulley reduces the effort needed.

questions: 14Why is a ramp considered an inclined plane?
answers: 14It allows heavy loads to be moved upward more easily over a longer distance.

questions: 15How does increasing the length of a lever arm affect the effort needed?
answers: 15It decreases the effort needed to lift a load.

questions: 16What is a compound machine?
answers: 16A machine made of two or more simple machines working together.

questions: 17How do simple machines affect energy use?
answers: 17They do not reduce the total amount of work but make it easier by changing how it is done.

questions: 18What role does friction play in the efficiency of simple machines?
answers: 18Friction reduces efficiency by converting some input energy into heat.

questions: 19How is a wedge similar to an inclined plane?
answers: 19Both are sloped surfaces, but a wedge moves through objects while an inclined plane stays stationary.

questions: 20What is an example of a compound machine that includes a lever and a wheel and axle?
answers: 20A wheelbarrow, which uses both to lift and move loads with less effort.
